Momocs 1.3.2
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Turn Momocs objects into tydy data_frames

Source: R/babel-bridges.R
as_df.Rd

Used in particular for compatibility with the tidyverse

as_df(x, ...)

# S3 method for Coo
as_df(x, ...)

# S3 method for Coe
as_df(x, ...)

# S3 method for PCA
as_df(x, retain, ...)

# S3 method for LDA
as_df(x, retain, ...)

Arguments

x

an object, typically a Momocs object
...

useless here
retain

numeric for use with scree methods. Defaut to all. If <1, enough axes to retain this proportion of variance; if >1, this number of axes.

Value

a dplyr::data_frame

See also

Other bridges functions: bridges, complex, export()

Examples

# first, some (baby) objects
b <- bot %>% coo_sample(12)
bf <- b %>% efourier(5, norm=TRUE)
# Coo object
b %>% as_df
#> # A tibble: 40 x 3
#>    coo                type   fake 
#>  * <named list>       <fct>  <fct>
#>  1 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  2 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  3 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  4 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  5 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  6 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  7 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  8 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#>  9 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#> 10 <dbl[,2] [12 × 2]> whisky a    
#> # … with 30 more rows
# Coe object
bf %>% as_df
#> # A tibble: 40 x 22
#>    type  fake     A1      A2     A3      A4     A5    B1       B2       B3
#>  * <fct> <fct> <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 whis… a      1    0.0120  0.0917 0.0124  0.0248     0 -1.12e-3 -0.00100
#>  2 whis… a      1    0.0110  0.0918 0.0124  0.0224     0 -1.25e-3 -0.00280
#>  3 whis… a      1    0.0213  0.0770 0.0240  0.0140     0 -6.37e-3  0.00124
#>  4 whis… a      1    0.00905 0.0960 0.00971 0.0263     0 -5.55e-4 -0.00204
#>  5 whis… a      1.   0.0208  0.0913 0.0208  0.0193     0 -1.08e-3  0.00113
#>  6 whis… a      1.   0.0200  0.0722 0.0213  0.0119     0 -2.15e-3  0.00349
#>  7 whis… a      1    0.00998 0.0912 0.0122  0.0248     0 -1.72e-4 -0.00124
#>  8 whis… a      1    0.0197  0.0845 0.0217  0.0164     0 -4.64e-4 -0.00144
#>  9 whis… a      1    0.0194  0.0864 0.0214  0.0191     0 -2.88e-3 -0.00196
#> 10 whis… a      1.00 0.0128  0.0929 0.0141  0.0236     0 -9.98e-4 -0.00170
#> # … with 30 more rows, and 12 more variables: B4 <dbl>, B5 <dbl>, C1 <dbl>,
#> #   C2 <dbl>, C3 <dbl>, C4 <dbl>, C5 <dbl>, D1 <dbl>, D2 <dbl>, D3 <dbl>,
#> #   D4 <dbl>, D5 <dbl>

# PCA object
bf %>% PCA %>% as_df     # all PCs by default
#> `retain` is too ambitious. All axes returned
#> # A tibble: 40 x 22
#>    type  fake      PC1      PC2      PC3      PC4      PC5      PC6      PC7
#>  * <fct> <fct>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 whis… a     -0.0520  0.0226  -5.17e-3 -8.66e-3  1.31e-2  1.09e-3  5.06e-3
#>  2 whis… a     -0.0356 -0.00197  8.80e-3 -8.00e-3  1.67e-3 -4.14e-3 -3.06e-5
#>  3 whis… a      0.0811  0.00232  2.02e-3  3.07e-3  7.56e-4 -3.99e-3  3.37e-3
#>  4 whis… a     -0.0694  0.00396  1.15e-2 -7.18e-3 -1.72e-3 -4.63e-3  1.78e-3
#>  5 whis… a     -0.0146 -0.0455   6.62e-3  3.05e-3 -2.45e-5  1.69e-2 -1.31e-3
#>  6 whis… a      0.121   0.0208   1.68e-3 -1.15e-2  2.42e-3 -2.48e-3 -2.55e-3
#>  7 whis… a     -0.0428  0.0170   3.59e-3 -3.29e-4 -3.13e-3  1.78e-3  4.73e-3
#>  8 whis… a      0.0343 -0.00950  9.59e-4 -7.64e-3  6.12e-3  2.03e-3 -5.70e-4
#>  9 whis… a      0.0114 -0.00619 -2.07e-3  2.98e-3  5.44e-3 -2.31e-4  3.57e-3
#> 10 whis… a     -0.0440 -0.00410  2.85e-3 -3.67e-3  3.75e-3  7.95e-4 -2.55e-4
#> # … with 30 more rows, and 13 more variables: PC8 <dbl>, PC9 <dbl>, PC10 <dbl>,
#> #   PC11 <dbl>, PC12 <dbl>, PC13 <dbl>, PC14 <dbl>, PC15 <dbl>, PC16 <dbl>,
#> #   PC17 <dbl>, PC18 <dbl>, PC19 <dbl>, PC20 <dbl>
bf %>% PCA %>% as_df(2) # or 2
#> # A tibble: 40 x 4
#>    type   fake      PC1      PC2
#>  * <fct>  <fct>   <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 whisky a     -0.0520  0.0226 
#>  2 whisky a     -0.0356 -0.00197
#>  3 whisky a      0.0811  0.00232
#>  4 whisky a     -0.0694  0.00396
#>  5 whisky a     -0.0146 -0.0455 
#>  6 whisky a      0.121   0.0208 
#>  7 whisky a     -0.0428  0.0170 
#>  8 whisky a      0.0343 -0.00950
#>  9 whisky a      0.0114 -0.00619
#> 10 whisky a     -0.0440 -0.00410
#> # … with 30 more rows
bf %>% PCA %>% as_df(0.99) # or enough for 99%
#> # A tibble: 40 x 8
#>    type   fake      PC1      PC2       PC3       PC4        PC5       PC6
#>  * <fct>  <fct>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>
#>  1 whisky a     -0.0520  0.0226  -0.00517  -0.00866   0.0131     0.00109 
#>  2 whisky a     -0.0356 -0.00197  0.00880  -0.00800   0.00167   -0.00414 
#>  3 whisky a      0.0811  0.00232  0.00202   0.00307   0.000756  -0.00399 
#>  4 whisky a     -0.0694  0.00396  0.0115   -0.00718  -0.00172   -0.00463 
#>  5 whisky a     -0.0146 -0.0455   0.00662   0.00305  -0.0000245  0.0169  
#>  6 whisky a      0.121   0.0208   0.00168  -0.0115    0.00242   -0.00248 
#>  7 whisky a     -0.0428  0.0170   0.00359  -0.000329 -0.00313    0.00178 
#>  8 whisky a      0.0343 -0.00950  0.000959 -0.00764   0.00612    0.00203 
#>  9 whisky a      0.0114 -0.00619 -0.00207   0.00298   0.00544   -0.000231
#> 10 whisky a     -0.0440 -0.00410  0.00285  -0.00367   0.00375    0.000795
#> # … with 30 more rows

# LDA object
bf %>% LDA(~fake) %>% as_df
#> removed these collinear columns:A1, B1, C1
#> # A tibble: 40 x 8
#>    actual predicted posterior type   fake     LD1    LD2     LD3
#>  * <fct>  <fct>         <dbl> <fct>  <fct>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>
#>  1 a      a             1.00  whisky a     -4.19   1.84  -1.56  
#>  2 a      a             0.997 whisky a     -2.74   1.68  -0.0456
#>  3 a      a             0.878 whisky a     -2.26   0.171 -0.293 
#>  4 a      a             0.935 whisky a     -3.17  -0.527 -0.611 
#>  5 a      a             0.997 whisky a     -2.97   1.54   0.665 
#>  6 a      a             0.989 whisky a     -4.64  -0.937  0.385 
#>  7 a      d             0.620 whisky a     -0.109  2.26  -0.0356
#>  8 a      a             0.999 whisky a     -4.20   0.797  0.520 
#>  9 a      a             0.994 whisky a     -2.97   0.925 -0.640 
#> 10 a      b             0.826 whisky a     -1.52  -0.749  0.113 
#> # … with 30 more rows
# same options apply
